## Boston Massacre: A Simple Summary

The Boston Massacre happened on March 5, 1770. A crowd of people in Boston started throwing things at British soldiers. The soldiers, feeling threatened, shot back, killing five people. This event was called a "massacre" by American leaders who wanted independence from Britain. The soldiers were put on trial, and most were found not guilty. This event made tensions between the American colonies and Britain even worse.
